candidates.name: Bounded Prime Gaps (Zhang/Polymath)
candidates.notes: SKIPPED: Requires sieve theory (Selberg, GPY) not in Mathlib. Bombieri-Vinogradov missing. Multi-year effort.

candidates.name: Weak Goldbach Conjecture (Helfgott)
candidates.notes: COMPLETED: Formalization work done. We have: canonical statement, decidable instances (enables `decide` for any n), structural reduction (binary⟹weak). Full proof requires circle method (out of scope). Enumeration removed as zero-value busywork.

candidates.name: Szemerédi's Theorem
candidates.notes: COMPLETED k=3: Roth's theorem proved via Mathlib's corners chain (Regularity→Triangle Removal→Corners→Roth). Equivalence IsAPFree↔ThreeAPFree. k≥4 still needs hypergraph regularity (axiom).

candidates.name: Twin Primes in Special Forms
candidates.notes: Proved: twin primes > 3 must have form (6k-1, 6k+1). Structure theorem.

candidates.name: Collatz for Structured Starting Values
candidates.notes: COMPLETED: Proved 2^k reaches 1, closure under 2x, verified 3,5,6,7,9,27.

candidates.name: P≠NP Barrier Formalization
candidates.notes: SURVEYED: PNPBarriers.lean (~1190 lines, 0 sorries). Session 5 (2026-01-01): Added Part 11 - coNP, NP∩coNP, coNP-completeness. Proved P⊆coNP, NP≠coNP→P≠NP, P=NP→NP=coNP. FACTORING/GRAPH_ISOMORPHISM examples. TAUTOLOGY coNP-complete. Complete framework for P/NP/coNP/PSPACE/EXP containments, all 3 barriers.

candidates.name: Explicit Prime Gap Bounds
candidates.notes: Proved π(2n) > π(n) from Bertrand. Stated p_n ≤ 2^n as axiom.

candidates.name: 2D Navier-Stokes Regularity
candidates.notes: SKIPPED: No PDE infrastructure in Mathlib. Requires defining NS equations, Sobolev spaces, weak solutions from scratch.

candidates.name: Riemann Hypothesis Consequences
candidates.notes: SURVEYED: Session 6 (2026-01-01): Added Li's criterion (RH↔λₙ≥0), Riemann-von Mangoldt zero counting, completed zeta (xi function), ζ(6)/ζ(8) formulas. Session 5: Mathlib zeta infrastructure. ~632 lines, 9 axioms, 25+ proven theorems.

candidates.name: Legendre Conjecture Partial
candidates.notes: COMPLETED: Verified Legendre for n=1 to 20 with explicit prime witnesses.

candidates.name: Hurwitz Quaternion Theorem
candidates.notes: SKIPPED: Already in HurwitzTheorem.lean (~1680 lines). Has complete proofs for n=1,2,4 identities, n=3 impossibility theorem, Hurwitz theorem statement with n=8/only-if as axioms, division algebra formalization.

candidates.name: Infinitely Many Primes ≡ 1 (mod 4)
candidates.notes: SKIPPED: Already in DirichletsTheorem.lean:196 as infinitely_many_primes_1_mod_4

candidates.name: Infinitely Many Primes ≡ 3 (mod 4)
candidates.notes: SKIPPED: Already in DirichletsTheorem.lean:210 as infinitely_many_primes_3_mod_4

candidates.name: Sophie Germain Prime Structure
candidates.notes: COMPLETED: SophieGermain.lean with structure theorem (p>3 SG prime => p≡5 mod 6), safe prime mod 12, 10 verified examples (2,3,5,11,23,29,41,53,83,89), non-examples, Cunningham chain 2→5→11→23, conjecture as axiom.

candidates.name: Sum of Divisors Properties
candidates.notes: SKIPPED: Already covered by PerfectNumbers.lean which has σ(2^k), Euclid-Euler theorem, examples.

candidates.name: Möbius Inversion Formula
candidates.notes: SKIPPED: Already in Mathlib as sum_eq_iff_sum_mul_moebius_eq (rings), sum_eq_iff_sum_smul_moebius_eq (additive groups), prod_eq_iff_prod_pow_moebius_eq (multiplicative). ζ*μ=1 as coe_zeta_mul_moebius.

candidates.name: Prime Counting Function Bounds
candidates.notes: SKIPPED: Explicit Chebyshev bounds not in Mathlib. Already have PNT (axiom) + Bertrand bounds in PrimeGapBounds.lean.

candidates.name: Chinese Remainder Theorem (Constructive)
candidates.notes: COMPLETED: ChineseRemainderConstructive.lean with existence/uniqueness, Bézout coefficients, explicit solution formula, Sunzi problem (23 mod 105), 3-moduli extension, RNS application.

candidates.name: Vieta's Formulas
candidates.notes: COMPLETED: VietasFormulas.lean with quadratic/cubic formulas, polynomial coeff theorem, examples.

candidates.name: Wolstenholme's Theorem
candidates.notes: COMPLETED: Computational verification for p=5,7,11,13. Babbage (mod p²) for p≥3. Failure cases p=2,3. Full theorem + Babbage as axioms. Wolstenholme primes definition. Harmonic number connection.

candidates.name: Frobenius Number (Two Coprime)
candidates.notes: SKIPPED: Already in Mathlib as frobeniusNumber_pair in Mathlib.NumberTheory.FrobeniusNumber. Proves m*n-m-n is Frobenius number for coprime m,n.

candidates.name: Kummer's Theorem on Binomial Divisibility
candidates.notes: COMPLETED: KummerTheorem.lean proves ν_p(C(n,k)) = #carries when adding k + (n-k) in base p. Uses Mathlib's Nat.Prime.multiplicity_choose. Includes Lucas theorem connection, Legendre formula, examples for C(10,4), C(6,3), C(8,2), prime power divisibility theorem.

candidates.name: Primitive Roots Modulo Primes
candidates.notes: COMPLETED: PrimitiveRoots.lean proves for prime p there are exactly φ(p-1) primitive roots. Uses isCyclic_of_subgroup_isDomain to show (Z/pZ)* is cyclic, then IsCyclic.card_orderOf_eq_totient. Includes existence theorem, generator characterization, examples for p=2,3,5,7,11,13.

candidates.name: Explicit Ramsey Number Lower Bounds
candidates.notes: COMPLETED: Added pentagon coloring construction to RamseysTheorem.lean (~150 new lines). Proved R(3,3) > 5 via explicit 2-coloring of K_5 with no monochromatic triangle. Key theorems: pentagonColoring, pentagon_no_red_clique, pentagon_no_blue_clique, ramsey_3_3_lower_bound, ramsey_3_3_at_least_6. Combined with existing ramseyBound 3 3 = 6, proves R(3,3) = 6 exactly.

candidates.name: Legendre's Three Squares Theorem
candidates.notes: n is sum of 3 squares iff n ≠ 4^a(8b+7). NOT in Mathlib. Classic number theory. Connects to LagrangeFourSquares.lean. Wiedijk #100 list candidate.

candidates.name: Schur's Theorem (Sum-Free Colorings)
candidates.notes: COMPLETED: SchursTheorem.lean proves S(1)=2, S(2)=5 exactly (upper bound via exhaustive case analysis, lower bound via sum-free coloring {1,4}, {2,3}). Includes IsSchurTriple, IsSumFree, HasMonochromaticSchurTriple definitions, sum-free partition characterization (schur_equiv_no_sum_free). General existence for r≥3 requires multicolor Ramsey (not formalized). ~320 lines, 1 sorry (r≥3 case only).

candidates.name: Burnside Lemma Applications
candidates.notes: Apply Mathlib's MulAction.sum_card_fixedBy_eq_card_orbits_mul_card_group to classic counting: necklaces, cube colorings. Connects to SylowTheorem.lean and group action theory.

candidates.name: Erdős-Ko-Rado Theorem
candidates.notes: Maximum intersecting family of k-subsets of n-set has size C(n-1,k-1) for n ≥ 2k. Classic extremal combinatorics. May need custom infrastructure.
